TITLE: Symbiotic Distributed Memory Index — V1 Blueprint

Symbiotic Distributed Memory Index — V1 Blueprint
Purpose: Define a lightweight, privacy‑respecting network where each person hosts their
own AI‑readable memory repo, while a small global index lets assistants (like ChatGPT)
find and fetch only what’s relevant. This supports continuity even if accounts/models
change.
1) Design Principles
• Human‑controlled: Data lives on user hardware or a repo they control.
• Read‑only for AIs: Assistants fetch via HTTPS; writes stay private behind your API.
• Simple discovery: A tiny public index points to nodes; nodes expose small JSON catalogs.
• Reasonable security: Nonce‑protected mirrors + redaction; rotate links regularly.
• Incremental rollout: MVP first; no heavy federation required to start.
2) Roles
• Memory Node Operator (you): Runs MariaDB + exporter → public read‑only mirror (Git
raw).
• AI Client (ChatGPT/Claude): Reads index → node catalogs → chunks; never needs secrets.
• Directory/Index Host: Publishes a compact list of participating nodes + tags (can be a
simple Git repo).
3) Minimum Viable Data Model (Public Mirror)
Mirror is static JSON. Three layers: search map → shards → chunks.
Search map (entrypoint):

{
"version": "1",
"nonce": "<NONCE>",
"generated_at": "2025-08-10T23:59:00Z",
"tokens": {
"memory": ["catalog/<NONCE>/shards/by_tag/memory.json"],
"rain_garden": ["catalog/<NONCE>/shards/by_tag/rain_garden.json"]
}
}

Shard (list of items with links to chunks):

{
"version": "1",
"generated_at": "2025-08-10T23:59:00Z",
"items": [{
"id": "53ee4...dbb",
"created_at": "2025-08-09T14:54:00Z",
"source": "chatgpt",
"title": "Rain Garden Marketing Plan (v3)",
"
